hypothesis_content.title: Bull Regime Asian Session Breakout Pullback
hypothesis_content.statement: During a BULL regime, if BTC breaks above the previous day's high during the Asian trading session (00:00 - 08:00 UTC) on low relative volume (<80% of the prior 5-session average for that window), price will pull back to retest the breakout level within the next 12 hours, offering a high-probability long entry.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In a bull trend, breakouts on low volume are suspect and often lack follow-through. Market makers and algos may push price back to the breakout point to gather liquidity and confirm support. A successful retest in a bull regime is a classic high-conviction continuation signal.
entry_conditions: BTC price breaks above previous UTC day's high between 00:00 and 08:00 UTC
Volume during breakout window (00:00-08:00) is <80% of its 5-day average for the same window
Price trades back within 0.3% of the previous day's high (the breakout level)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: 1.5% below the retest level (previous day's high)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: After a low-volume Asian breakout and subsequent retest, price fails to continue upwards (win rate <60%) or the retest level fails to hold as support in >35% of cases.
